post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, February 15
post.Content:
A lighter week this week, with only a few links that I could find. Nonetheless - enjoy :-)

  • Alexander Casall has a post on jaxenter detailing 20 JavaFX real-world applications.
  • Johan Vos will be giving a free Oracle Virtual Technology Summit talk about Java on Mobile in April and May. Sign up now!
  • Hendrik Ebbers has this week posted about JavaFX and CSS Pseudo Classes. Knowing how to work with pseudo classes in JavaFX CSS is a very useful skill to have!
  • Gerrit Grunwald has also been iterating on his Medusa gauge library. I won't even bother to mention a version number this week, because it is probably already wrong :-)
  • Thomas Nield has released an updated version of RxJavaFX to improve interop between RxJava and JavaFX.
